publication.translation[0].definitions[0: the process of printing a book, magazine etc and offering it for sale
She was in England for the publication of her new book.
He spent his holiday writing reviews for publication.
publication.translation[0].definitions[1: He was the author of 70 major scientific publications.
publication.translation[0].definitions[2: when information is printed in a book, magazine etc so that the public can read it
the publication of the company’s annual results
publication.translation[1].definitions[0: the act of making a book, magazine etc available for sale, or the time at which this is done
the publication of books with titles like ‘The Great American Collapse’
This novel began attracting attention well before its publication date.
publication.translation[1].definitions[1: The ads will run in publications like ‘The New York Times’ and ‘The Wall Street Journal’.
Media Industry Newsletter, a trade publication (=a newspaper for people in a particular profession or industry)
publication.translation[1].definitions[2: the act of making something known to the public
the publication of large share deals on the Stock Exchange Automated Quotation system
